titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jack Randall Crawford Papers
titlestmt.author: Preliminary Inventory

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 08:23

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, diaries, an autobiography, writings, research notes, and teaching materials of Jack Randall Crawford. Also included are a small amount of papers belonging to Dorothy Gabain, Crawford's second wife. The largest part of the papers is made up of plays, fiction and literary criticism, both published and unpublished, written by Crawford. Also included are lecture notes and texts and students papers reflecting his teaching career at Yale University (1909-1946).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jack Randall Crawford Papers (MS 153). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jack Randall Crawford: author, educator; professor of English at Yale University, 1909-1946; professor emeritus, 1946-1968; author of novels and studies of literature.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, diaries, an autobiography, writings, research notes, and teaching materials of Jack Randall Crawford. Also included are a small amount of papers belonging to Dorothy Gabain, Crawford's second wife. The largest part of the papers is made up of plays, fiction and literary criticism, both published and unpublished, written by Crawford. Also included are lecture notes and texts and students papers reflecting his teaching career at Yale University (1909-1946).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Associate Professor of English, Yale University
Original fiction, scholarly discussion, various notes, and lectures of Jack Randall Crawford are contained here in 25 boxes.

did.unittitle: "To those who are left, to my children who do not know these things, and to the memory of those more numerous who have gone." -- an autobiographical work; three copies are present. Each copy has its own variant.
For the Most Fair (a fictional work - one copy)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes two incongruous manuscripts, only one of which is complete.

did.unittitle: Also an incomplete and untitled manuscript (Chps II - XXVII)
Discussion of Joan Lowell's Cradle of the Deep
Discussion of John Rathbone Oliver's Foursquare, The Story of a Foursquare Life
Report by JRC to the movie owners of Abie's Wild Irish Rose
Review of the Wall of Glass by Amabel Williams-Ellis
Great Moments in History, McCormick and the Reaper
The Ghost of Hamlet (historical approach to the dramatic ghost)

unittitle.title: Death of a Soldier of Fortune

did.unittitle: Fruits of Culture by Leo Tolstoi - adapted by JRC for the Drama
Fragment of a play, Act II: possibility that it might be Fruits of Culture
Senlac (2 copies; each is five acts)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Awarded the John Addison Porter Prize.

did.unittitle: Lovely Peggy (with notes) -- one copy of the three acts in hardcover notebooks
The Glass House (first and third copies complete; acts three and four of another copy)
Lovely Peggy (2 copies-- one complete in one volume; the other bound in three volumes.)

unittitle.title: At the End of the Passage

did.unittitle: Behind the Beyond by Stephen Leacock
fragments of two plays, probably by JRC
The Pursuit of Happiness -- prose work
Character of Drayton Fisher (personality presumably to be used by JRG in his writings)
Notes on drama and the history of drama
Notes on drama and the history of drama
Notes on literary forms and schools. realism, naturalism, romanticism, etc.
Manual on the short story and composition; also Knights of Columbus Home Education Study by JRC.
Notes on psychology and psychological interpretations; also tragedy, comedy, poetry etc.
Notes on bibliography and reading lists
Notes on bibliography -- including "What to Read in English Literature"
Notes on criticism and personalities in drama
Notes for lectures and texts for various lectures
Notes on creation and expression: miscellaneous material included
Filing drawer: catalogue cards on Hamlet
Filing drawer: catalogue cards on the theory of the drama
I Walked in Arden (a rather confused and incoherent compilation of manuscripts which hopefully belong to "Arden")
Cupid and Psyche by John Jay Chapman (JRC's stage notes are integrated in the text.)

unittitle.title: The Pageant of the Peddie Institute and the Community of Highstown, New Jersey

did.unittitle: The Joy Ride (a synopsis of the four act play)
Sandfield's Laboratory (story) Cases I, II, III
one untitled novel (20 chapters) by JRC
Report of Chief Reader (JRC) of Comprehensive Exams
"Report of the reading of the comprehensive English books for the new plan candidates"
Coviello - a commedia dell'arte in two acts
Do Not Do To Others by Roberto Braceo - translated and adapted by JRC.
Polly Twaddles [The reader is required to fill in all the dialogue blanks himself.]
Father Duval (a synopsis of the play)
review of The Revolutionary Playwright's Handbook by G.B. Shaw; Ulysses - a drama by Stephen Phillips
The Gift of Stone (4 pages) by JRC
One page papers written for Professors Phelps and Nettleton
Poems and limericks written for amusement
4 unidentified plays in various stages of survival
One battered and coverless notebook filled with personal sketches and personal experiences of JRC.
Constitution of Chi Delta Theta, honary literary society of Yale University, founded Nov. 6, 1821
Memorandum of interview with JRC re Overton matter. Also handwritten note of Preident Hadley re Overton.
Readings for Timothy Dwight Christmas Party
Report on books read for Professor Nettleton's Drama Course - date
Sheffield Scientific School - outline of Sophomore English
Speech given by JRC to the New England Association of Teachers of English
Correspondence and reviews and articles by/about JRC
Carl Lohman to JRC: official certificates
John M. Burke to Mrs. T.C. Crawford
Mrs. John A. Logan to Mrs. T. C. (Inez R.) Crawford
Programs of JRC's productions (largely from the Dartmouth summer sessions 1915-1918)
Program for Waterbury, Conn. pageant - JRC, director
Various papers and magazines with articles by/about JRC
2 issues of Creative Reading (JRC - author and co-author)
University of Southern California catalogues for the 1936 summer session. JRC's courses listed and described
Untitled novel - published in Canada. one copy, typed
Notebooks, two hardcover: dated June and September 1910, but entries continue to 1951-1952

odd.head: General
odd.p: Contains sketches, notes for classes, and preliminary exam and test questions.

did.unittitle: Essay on Class of 1901, "Upper Middle First" at Berkeley School, Princeton
19th Century European Politics. Also some verse (Yale)
Dramatic Composition. Contains lyric "Do You Remember" (1951)
"Durham's Course" seemingly on 18th Century Philosophy. Also includes "Along these Lines," an assembly of clichés compiled from "much reading of fiction"
Contemporary Drama, including a "Theater Record" and a "Yale diary"
Old English. Mostly containing short sketches
Some notes on steel making, mostly notes from a French course.
Untitled fictional work and essay "Chemical Theory Simplified"
Travel Sketches, essays "Hypnotism and Crime" and "Curvature in Greek Architecture"

Essays "The Pre-Raphaelites", "A Plea for Romanticism", "Callow Pessimism". Story "On the Emperor's Staff." Essay "Notes on Brotherhood", "Analysis of a Story", story and play suggestions, a translated poem and Act I of a play "Between Anecdotes"
Short play "The Turkey Gobbler", sketch of a novel, "Ulysses" by Stephen Phillips (an essay on it), story "The Emperor of a Republic," sketch "The Girl in the Raglan" and some verse
Story "A Legend from the North", one act comedy "The A.D.A.", some verse and sketches for stories and plays.
Essay "Religion" and a translation, Act I of Maeterlinck's "Momma Vanna"
Sketches "A Coaching Trip" and "Smith", ideas for short stories, "The Rainbow Knight," a play, a passenger list and essay "Youth's Idleness"
Magazine, Ainslee's , in which Crawford's article "Bridge" appears
"Sandfield's Laboratory", essay "Audiences 170 Years Ago", verses and sketches for plays
Seven Spades to Death , manuscripts of a murder mystery
Albert Enters the World , a novel, chapters 6-12 inclus
Albert Enters the World , novel, chapters 13 to end
To My Children and Grandchildren , an autobiography
essay "The Growth of English Comedy", and part of a play "The Impostor"

essay "The Growth of English Comedy II" and sources for this essay. Includes notes and parts of play "The Company Promoter", adapted part of play "La Petíte Fundtionnaire", a European travel essay, a sketch "Mesopotamia"
Notes on medieval drama and on cement-making
Packet of letters and two stories, "The Rambler", and "After Five Years."
"Lucia d'Andrea", a comedy by K Dove, translated and adapted by J.R. Crawford, and an untitled play by Crawford
Notes for plays "The President and the Anarchist", "Senlac", "Father Vangu", notes on English drama, booklists, notes on metallurgical processes
Play "The Thursday Club", Acts I and II
Part of Crawford's adaptation of "La Petie Functionnaire" by Alfred Capus. Essay "Notes on Art in Life"
Play "The Promoter", parts of act I
Plays "Breaking the Colt (?)" and "Last Memory Play", some notes on metallurgy
Manuscripts of "Senlac", five act play, and "The Begsemenoffs", by Maxims Gorky, translated by Crawford. Also written version of acts II and III of "Begsemenoffs" and some press notices of this play
Part of an untitled play and notes on metallurgy
Book "The Answer of Adam" by H.N. McCracken
Articles for the Daily Princetonian and other publications
